qas.question: The tradition of the Dominican Order includes what?
What is one area the Dominican Order puts emphasis on?
What is one way that the Dominican Order differentiates itself from other religious orders?
In what country did some of the Dominican Order attributes change?

plausible_answers.text: for a deeply personal, intimate relationship with God.

qas.question: What did the friars and sisters in Christ not struggle with?

context: The spiritual tradition of <b5_0>Dominic's Order<b5_0/> is punctuated not only by <a0_0><b4_0>charity<a0_0/>, study and preaching<b4_0/>, but also by instances of mystical union. The <b6_0>Dominican<b6_0/> emphasis on <a1_0>learning<a1_0/> and on <a2_0>charity<a2_0/> distinguishes it from other monastic and mendicant orders. As the order first developed on the European continent, learning continued to be emphasized by these friars and their sisters in Christ. These religious also struggled <b8_0>for a deeply personal, intimate relationship with God.<b8_0/> When the order reached <a3_0><b7_0>England<b7_0/><a3_0/>, many of these attributes were kept, but the English gave the order additional, specialized characteristics.
